org.wcardinal.configuration

Interface WCardinalConfiguration

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WCardinalConfigurationSupport

    public interface WCardinalConfiguration
    Provides methods for configuring Winter Cardinal.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaximumBinaryMessageSize

        int getMaximumBinaryMessageSize()
        Returns the maximum size of binary messages in bytes. The default value is 500000. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.message.binary.size.max` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        the maximum size of binary messages in bytes.
        See Also:
        setMaximumBinaryMessageSize(int)

      • setMaximumBinaryMessageSize

        WCardinalConfiguration setMaximumBinaryMessageSize(int limit)
        Sets the maximum size of binary messages.
        Parameters:
        limit - the maximum size of binary messages in bytes
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        getMaximumBinaryMessageSize()

      • getMaximumTextMessageSize

        int getMaximumTextMessageSize()
        Returns the maximum size of text messages. The default value is 62500. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.message.text.size.max` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        the maximum size of text messages
        See Also:
        setMaximumTextMessageSize(int)

      • getMaximumIdleTime

        long getMaximumIdleTime()
        Returns the maximum idle time in milliseconds. The default value is 30000. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.idle.max` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        the maximum idle time in milliseconds
        See Also:
        setMaximumIdleTime(long)

      • setMaximumIdleTime

        WCardinalConfiguration setMaximumIdleTime(long idleTime)
        Sets the maximum idle time in milliseconds. A browser who have not sent any messages for this time span is considered inactive and disconnected.
        Parameters:
        idleTime - the maximum idle time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        getMaximumIdleTime()

      • getMaximumDisconnectionTime

        long getMaximumDisconnectionTime()
        Returns the maximum disconnection time in milliseconds. If it is negative, the maximum disconnection time is not checked. The default value is -1. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.disconnection.max` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        the maximum disconnection time in milliseconds
        See Also:
        setMaximumDisconnectionTime(long)

      • setMaximumDisconnectionTime

        WCardinalConfiguration setMaximumDisconnectionTime(long disconnectionTime)
        Sets the maximum disconnection time in milliseconds. A browser who have been disconnected for this time span is considered inactive.
        Parameters:
        disconnectionTime - the maximum disconnection time in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        getMaximumDisconnectionTime()

      • getWebSocketPath

        java.lang.String getWebSocketPath()
        Returns the URL of the WebSocket endpoint. The default value is "**\/wcardinal-websocket". The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.websocket.path` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        the URL of the WebSocket endpoint
        See Also:
        setWebSocketPath(String)

        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        getWebSocketPath()

      • getAllowedOrigins

        java.lang.String[] getAllowedOrigins()
        Returns the allowed origins. The default value is an empty string array. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.allowed-origins` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        the allowed origins
        See Also:
        setAllowedOrigins(String...)

        Returns:

      • isControllerHttpEnabled

        boolean isControllerHttpEnabled()
        Returns true if HTTP requests of controllers area allowed. The default value is true. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.controller.http` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        true if HTTP requests of controllers area allowed
        See Also:
        setControllerHttpEnabled(boolean)

      • setControllerHttpEnabled

        WCardinalConfiguration setControllerHttpEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether HTTP requests of controllers are allowed.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to allow, false to disallow the controller requests
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        isControllerHttpEnabled()

      • isControllerVariableEmbeddable

        boolean isControllerVariableEmbeddable()
        Returns true if controller variables are embeddable. The default value is true. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.controller.variable.embedding` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        true if controller variables are embeddable
        See Also:
        setControllerVariableEmbeddable(boolean)

      • setControllerVariableEmbeddable

        WCardinalConfiguration setControllerVariableEmbeddable(boolean embeddable)
        Sets whether controller variables are embeddable.
        Parameters:
        embeddable - true to make controller variables embeddable
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        isControllerVariableEmbeddable()

      • setEmbeddedControllerVariableEncoding

        WCardinalConfiguration setEmbeddedControllerVariableEncoding(ControllerVariableEncoding encoding)
        Sets to the specified encoding of embedded controller variables. The default value is "REPLACE". The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.controller.variable.embedding.encoding` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Parameters:
        encoding - encoding
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        setEmbeddedControllerVariableEncoding(ControllerVariableEncoding)

      • getDefaultProtocols

        java.lang.String[] getDefaultProtocols()
        Returns the default communication protocols. The default value is "websocket,polling-100". The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.io.protocol.defaults` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        default communication protocols
        See Also:
        setDefaultProtocols(String...)

      • getSyncConnectTimeout

        long getSyncConnectTimeout()
        Returns the connection request timeout of the synchronization process. The default value is 5000. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.sync.connect.timeout` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        the connection request timeout of the synchronization process
        See Also:
        setSyncConnectTimeout(long)

      • getSyncClientProcessInterval

        long getSyncClientProcessInterval()
        Returns the client-side sync process interval in milliseconds. If the interval is 0 or less, sync messages are processed immediately. The default value is 0. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.sync.client.process.interval` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        the client-side sync process interval in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        setSyncClientProcessInterval(long)

      • setSyncClientProcessInterval

        WCardinalConfiguration setSyncClientProcessInterval(long interval)
        Sets the client-side sync process interval in milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        interval - the client-side sync process interval in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        getSyncClientProcessInterval()

      • getMaximumTriggerQueueSize

        int getMaximumTriggerQueueSize()
        Returns the maximum number of queued trigger requests per controllers. This is to avoid consuming large memory. If it is 0 or less, imposes no restrictions. The default value is 100. The default value can be changed by setting a property `wcardinal.trigger.queue.size.max` in properties files, command-line arguments, etc.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of queued trigger messages.
        See Also:
        setMaximumTriggerQueueSize(int)

      • setMaximumTriggerQueueSize

        WCardinalConfiguration setMaximumTriggerQueueSize(int size)
        Sets the maximum number of queued trigger requests.
        Parameters:
        size - maximum number of queued trigger requests.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        getMaximumTriggerQueueSize()
